intro: Kopsia cochinchinensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese kopsia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often with a reddish hue at the base. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
